intro: Hellenia arctiflora, commonly known as the arctic helena, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. Hellenia arctiflora is often found in tundra and mountainous areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
